title: Playful Valentine proposal page for Palak (single page with shrinking No + celebratory Yes)

requirements.summary: Create a single-page Valentine proposal UI addressed to Palak with prominent Yes/No buttons.
acceptanceCriteria: The page displays a clear prompt addressed to "Palak" asking her to be the user's Valentine.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create the app root component that renders the single Valentine proposal page view (no additional routes/pages).

Create the single-page UI with the prompt addressed to Palak and two prominent actions. Use the shadcn-ui Button component for consistent button styling and accessibility. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement progressive shrinking behavior for the No button on each click without breaking layout.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "No" reduces the button size on each click (e.g., scaling down step-by-step).
The "No" button continues shrinking on repeated clicks and never grows as a result of clicking "No".
The page remains usable (no layout-breaking overflow or jitter) as the "No" button shrinks.

file_operations.description: Add state-driven progressive scaling for the "No" button (e.g., decrement scale per click with a defined minimum), apply transform-based sizing to avoid layout jitter, and keep the surrounding layout stable as it shrinks. Use the shadcn-ui Button component as the base button element. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement Yes interaction that transitions the UI to a large celebratory message and prevents further No interaction.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Yes" displays the exact text: "YAYYYY I LOVEEEEEEE YOUUUUUUUU" (matching capitalization and spelling).
The message is visually large and clearly the primary content on the screen.
After clicking "Yes", the user can no longer trigger the shrinking "No" behavior (buttons are hidden/disabled or the view has transitioned).

file_operations.description: Add a "celebration" view state triggered by clicking "Yes" that replaces (or clearly transitions away from) the prompt/buttons and renders the exact celebratory message as the primary, large content; ensure the "No" shrink interaction cannot be triggered after transition.

requirements.summary: Apply a coherent playful Valentine-themed design (warm reds/pinks/creams) that is responsive and avoids blue/purple primary styling.
acceptanceCriteria: The page uses a consistent Valentine aesthetic (e.g., warm reds/pinks/creams, romantic typography choices, soft shadows).
The design is responsive and looks good on both mobile and desktop.
Primary styling does not use blue/purple as the dominant theme colors.

file_operations.description: Create the stylesheet imported by frontend/src/main.tsx to ensure Tailwind base/components/utilities are applied and to host any Valentine-specific base overrides needed by the single page (keeping a warm red/pink/cream palette and avoiding blue/purple as primary).

Adjust global CSS variables/theme tokens to align with a Valentine palette (warm reds/pinks/creams) and ensure the primary styling is not blue/purple; keep typography/spacing/shadows coherent with the single-page layout.

Implement responsive layout and Valentine styling (typography, spacing, soft shadows) using Tailwind classes; ensure mobile/desktop presentation remains visually balanced without introducing blue/purple as dominant colors.

requirements.summary: Add the required generated images as static assets and incorporate them into the Valentine page layout.
acceptanceCriteria: The specified image files exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The page visually incorporates the generated images (e.g., as a background/decoration) without fetching them from the backend.

file_operations.description: Add the generated seamless cute heart pattern background image asset at the required path for static use by the Valentine page.
Add the generated hand-drawn heart doodle image asset (transparent background) at the required path for static use by the Valentine page.

Wire the static assets into the layout by using frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-bg.dim_1920x1080.png as a decorative background and frontend/public/assets/generated/heart-doodle.dim_512x512.png as an on-page decoration (e.g., near the prompt/celebration), ensuring assets are loaded statically (no backend fetching).
